frame.name: Labor_product
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> or a <fen>Cause</fen> mentally or physically expends energy rendering an <fen>Input</fen>, whether implicit or explicit, into a <fen>Output</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Output">Erosion</fex> <m>is</m> the <t>work</t> <fex name="Cause">of wind and water</fex> <fex name="Input">on rock</fex>.</ex>
NB: The <fen>Input</fen> in the case of artistic <fen>Output</fen>, or an " artistic work" as more commonly referred to, is usually INI, because the material at hand being rendered is usually an idea or artistic material that is taken as common foreground knowledge by the semantics of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s professional role.
<ex>One of <fex name="Agent">Chinua Achebe's</fex> greatest <t>works</t> <m>was</m> <fex name="Output">Things Fall Apart</fex>. <fex name="Input">INI</fex></ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>A sentient entity whose physical and mental faculties are directly expended on the <fen>Input</fen> to create the <fen>Output</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition: <def-root>A non-sentient entity whose physical faculties are directly expended on the <fen>Input</fen> to create the <fen>Output</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Input
FE.definition: <def-root>The mental or physical faculties onto which the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> expends energy.</def-root>

FE.name: Output
FE.definition: <def-root>The end product, either a concept or physical object onto which the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> has exerted its mental or physical faculties from the rudimentary state of <fen>Input</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>A word or phrase that characterizes the target. </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Output</fen> was committed into reality.</def-root>

FE.name: Honoree
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity for whom the <fen>Output</fen> is created. </def-root>

FE.name: Presentation
FE.definition: <def-root>The place where the target or <fen>Output</fen> is presented.</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Descriptor</fen> is a chracterization or description of the <fen>Output</fen> that is not covered by any more-specific FE.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: oeuvre.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the life work of an artist.

lexUnit.name: work.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the product or result of one's effort.
